data.title: Thai Lion Air mulls flights
data.description: Thai Lion Air is considering operating flights to Nakhon Phanom as part of the government

data.title: iCon fraud victims can claim assets
data.description: Victims of the scandal-hit The iCon Group can now regain their assets from the Anti-Money Laundering Office (Amlo), the Department of Special Investigation (DSI) said yesterday.

data.title: Cash handout plan is 'probably illegal'
data.description: A former election commissioner has pointed out that the second phase of the 10,000-baht cash handout scheme risks violating the law as the government is due to distribute the money to 4 million elderly Thais during Chinese New Year, which is a few days before the elections of the chiefs of provincial administrative organisations (PAOs).

data.title: Govt to   build new bridge to Cambodia
data.description: The government is building a bridge that will permanently link Chanthaburi with Pailin province in Cambodia at a cost of about 15 million baht.

data.title: Lone dugong spotted in  Trang survey
data.description: Only one dugong was found during a week-long survey of a seagrass meadow in Trang that is known for dugong sightings, raising concerns about the species

data.title: Myanmar workers protest at being duped
data.description: SAMUT SAKHON: About 100 Myanmar workers protested in front of a factory in Muang district after they paid a group of Thai brokers 3,000-7,000 baht each but did not receive the promised jobs.

data.title: Kunlavut and Pornpawee march into quarter-finals
data.description: Kunlavut Vitidsarn booked his berth in the men

data.title: International Criminal Court seeks Israeli PM’s arrest
data.description: THE HAGUE - The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants on Thursday for Israeli Prime Minister  Benjamin Netanyahu  and his former defence chief, as well as a Hamas leader, Ibrahim Al-Masri, for alleged  war crimes  and crimes against humanity in the Gaza conflict.

data.title: Double majority backers prevail in referendum wrangle
data.description: The Senate has prevailed in the ongoing debate over the requirements for holding a  referendum  to amend the Thai  constitution .

data.title: House panel ‘cannot summon’ Thaksin
data.description: A House committee looking into claims that former prime minister  Thaksin Shinawatra  received privileged treatment at  Police General Hospital  during his detention there does not have the authority to summon him or agencies linked to the matter, according to the Department of Corrections.

data.title: Hun Sen urges diplomacy on Ko Kut, legal action on extremism
data.description: Senate President Hun Sen has stressed that national stability and positive relations with neighbouring countries are essential for a nation’s development.

data.title: Scrapping Cambodia pact ‘not feasible’
data.description: A petition by Thai citizens to cancel the 2001 Memorandum of Understanding ( MoU ) between Thailand and  Cambodia  regarding territorial claims is not legally feasible, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

data.title: Highway upgrade improves Bangkok-East travel
data.description: A section of  Highway 3481 , linking Bangkok to eastern provinces such as Chachoengsao and Prachin Buri, has been expanded to four traffic lanes from two, improving transport between the capital and the East.

data.title: Four legal and factual angles in the Khao Kradong Land case
data.description: Is political influence complicating a straightforward case in which a clear ruling has been issued?

data.title: Man arrested with dozens of tiger skin products
data.description: NAKHON SAWAN - Police have arrested a man with a wide range of products made from animal skins, mostly  tiger  hides, that he usually sold online.

data.title: Unicef turns Wat Arun blue for World Children's Day with youth leaders
data.description: On World Children's Day on November 20, Thailand's iconic Wat Arun was illuminated in Unicef blue as leaders from government, civil society, and business gathered with young people in a powerful display of commitment to improving children's futures.

data.title: Hun Manet defends government’s silence on Ko Kut dispute
data.description: Prime Minister Hun Manet has addressed the government’s decision to remain silent on the sovereignty dispute over Ko Kut, citing ongoing maritime border negotiations with Thailand that have yet to yield an agreement. Both nations currently claim the island as part of their territory.

data.title: Mackerel magic takes centre stage at Samut Sakhon festival
data.description: For the 14th year, the Tha Chalom community showcases its famous fresh fish in traditional favourites and innovative creations

data.title: Bridgestone Unveils  New Second-Generation Lunar Rover Tire Innovation
data.description: Bridgestone Corporation has made a significant leap in innovation with the development of its new lunar rover tire, designed to withstand the extreme conditions of the moon

data.title: Making a killing from earthworms, geckos and leeches
data.description: Locals in a Nakhon Phanom village are earning millions of baht in revenue from a unique trade

data.title: 20 new establishments make it to Michelin Guide Thailand
data.description: The 2025 Michelin Guide Thailand has added 20 new food establishments to its prestigious Bib Gourmand selection, bringing the total to 156.

data.title: K-pop CD glut draws fire as Korea hosts plastic waste talks
data.description: SEOUL - K-pop music may be South Korea

data.title: Vets consider trimming tusks of Plai Sak Surin to improve mobility
data.description: Carers say the rescued elephant’s tusks are too long and too heavy for him to comfortably navigate hills and avoid obstacles

data.title: One Bangkok unveils Sarapad Thai, a celebration of Thai craftsmanship
data.description: From homeware and fashion accessories to art toys and food products, store offers something for everyone

data.title: K-pop's profligate CD output draws fire as South Korea hosts plastic waste talks
data.description: SEOUL - K-pop music may be South Korea

data.title: Severe flooding alert for southern provinces
data.description: Southern provinces along the Gulf of Thailand and their neighbours are bracing for the impact of torrential rain expected to pound the region until at least Saturday.

data.title: Thailand's household debt rises to a worrying THB1.2 trillion
data.description: SME non-performing loans have seen a 20% year-on-year increase, NCB report reveals

data.title: House panel urges Thaksin to defend his ‘detention’ in hospital suite
data.description: Opposition MP who chairs the panel claims it is widely believed the ex-PM’s government connections allowed him special treatment

data.title: Thailand banks on affordable solar power to ease price burden on citizens
data.description: Development of an affordable solar power system prototype by NSTDA offers hope, says energy minister
